item.text: The land allotted to the tribe of Judah by its clans reached to the border of Edom, to the wilderness of Zin in the Negev far to the south.

<st data-num="01992" class="">Their</st> <st data-num="05045" class="">southern</st> <st data-num="01366" class="">border</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">started</st> at the <st data-num="05045" class="">southern</st> <st data-num="07097" class="">tip</st> of the <st data-num="04417" class="">Salt</st> <st data-num="03220 04480 03956 06437 05045">Sea</st>,<n id="1" />

<st data-num="03318 0413">extended</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="05045" class="">south</st> of the <st data-num="04610" class="">Scorpion</st> <st data-num="04608" class="">Ascent</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="05674" class="">crossed</st> to <st data-num="06790" class="">Zin</st>, <st data-num="05927" class="">went up</st> from the <st data-num="05045" class="">south</st> to <st data-num="06947" class="">Kadesh Barnea</st>, <st data-num="05674" class="">crossed</st> to <st data-num="02696" class="">Hezron</st>, <st data-num="05927" class="">went up</st> to <st data-num="0146" class="">Addar</st>, and <st data-num="05437" class="">turned</st> toward <st data-num="07173" class="">Karka</st>.
It then crossed to Azmon, extended to the Stream of Egypt, and ended at the Mediterranean Sea. This was their southern border.

The eastern border was the Salt Sea to the mouth of the Jordan River.

The northern border started north of the Salt Sea at the mouth of the Jordan,

<st data-num="05927 01366">went up</st> to <st data-num="01031" class="">Beth Hoglah</st>, <st data-num="05674" class="">crossed</st> <st data-num="06828" class="">north</st> of <st data-num="01026" class="">Beth Arabah</st>, and <st data-num="05927 01366">went up</st> to the <st data-num="068" class="">Stone</st> of <st data-num="0932" class="">Bohan</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="07205" class="">Reuben</st>.

<st data-num="01366" class="">It</st> then <st data-num="05927" class="">went up</st> to <st data-num="01688" class="">Debir</st> from the <st data-num="06010" class="">Valley</st> of <st data-num="05911" class="">Achor</st>, <st data-num="06437" class="">turning</st> <st data-num="06828" class="">northward</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="01537" class="">Gilgal</st> (<st data-num="0834" class="">which</st> is <st data-num="05227" class="">opposite</st> the <st data-num="04608" class="">Pass</st><n id="1" /> of <st data-num="0131" class="">Adummim</st> <st data-num="0834 05045">south</st> of the <st data-num="05158" class="">valley</st>), <st data-num="05674 01366">crossed</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="04325" class="">waters</st> of <st data-num="05885" class="">En Shemesh</st>, and <st data-num="08444 01961">extended</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="05883" class="">En Rogel</st>.

<st data-num="01366" class="">It</st> then <st data-num="05927" class="">went up</st> the <st data-num="01516" class="">Valley</st> of <st data-num="01121" class="">Ben</st> <st data-num="02011" class="">Hinnom</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="03802" class="">slope</st> of the <st data-num="02983" class="">Jebusites</st> on the <st data-num="05045" class="">south</st> (<st data-num="01931" class="">that</st> is, <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st>),<n id="1" /> <st data-num="05927 01366">going up</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="07218" class="">top</st> of the <st data-num="02022 0834">hill</st> <st data-num="05921 06440">opposite</st> the <st data-num="01516" class="">Valley</st> of Ben <st data-num="02011" class="">Hinnom</st> to the <st data-num="03220" class="">west</st>, <st data-num="0834" class="">which</st> is at the <st data-num="07097" class="">end</st> of the <st data-num="06010" class="">Valley</st> of the <st data-num="07497" class="">Rephaites</st> to the <st data-num="06828" class="">north</st>.

<st data-num="01366" class="">It</st> then <st data-num="08388" class="">went</st> from the <st data-num="07218" class="">top</st> of the <st data-num="02022" class="">hill</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="04599" class="">spring</st> of the <st data-num="04325" class="">waters</st> of <st data-num="05318" class="">Nephtoah</st>, <st data-num="03318" class="">extended</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="05892" class="">cities</st> of <st data-num="02022" class="">Mount</st> <st data-num="06085" class="">Ephron</st>, and <st data-num="01366 08388">went</st> to <st data-num="01173" class="">Baalah</st> (<st data-num="01931" class="">that</st> is, <st data-num="07157" class="">Kiriath Jearim</st>).

<st data-num="01366" class="">It</st> then <st data-num="05437" class="">turned</st> from <st data-num="01173" class="">Baalah</st> <st data-num="03220" class="">westward</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="02022" class="">Mount</st> <st data-num="08165" class="">Seir</st>, <st data-num="05674" class="">crossed</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="03802" class="">slope</st> of <st data-num="02022" class="">Mount</st> <st data-num="03297" class="">Jearim</st> on the <st data-num="06828" class="">north</st> (<st data-num="01931" class="">that</st> is <st data-num="03693" class="">Kesalon</st>), <st data-num="03381" class="">descended</st> to <st data-num="01053" class="">Beth Shemesh</st>, and <st data-num="05674" class="">crossed</st> to <st data-num="08553" class="">Timnah</st>.
It then extended to the slope of Ekron to the north, went toward Shikkeron, crossed to Mount Baalah, extended to Jabneel, and ended at the sea.
The western border was the Mediterranean Sea. These were the borders of the tribe of Judah and its clans.
Caleb son of Jephunneh was assigned Kiriath Arba (that is Hebron) within the tribe of Judah, according to the Lord’s instructions to Joshua. (Arba was the father of Anak.)

<st data-num="03612" class="">Caleb</st> <st data-num="03423" class="">drove out</st><n id="1" /> from <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st> <st data-num="07969" class="">three</st> <st data-num="01121 06061">Anakites</st>—<st data-num="08344" class="">Sheshai</st>, <st data-num="0289" class="">Ahiman</st>, and <st data-num="08526" class="">Talmai</st>, <st data-num="03211" class="">descendants</st> of <st data-num="06061" class="">Anak</st>.

From <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st> he <st data-num="05927 0413">attacked</st> the <st data-num="03427" class="">people</st> of <st data-num="01688" class="">Debir</st>.<n id="1" /> (<st data-num="01688" class="">Debir</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">used to</st> be <st data-num="08034" class="">called</st> <st data-num="07158" class="">Kiriath Sepher</st>.)

<st data-num="03612" class="">Caleb</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “To the man <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> <st data-num="05221" class="">attacks</st> and <st data-num="03920" class="">captures</st> Kiriath <st data-num="07158" class="">Sepher</st> I will <st data-num="05414" class="">give</st> my <st data-num="01323" class="">daughter</st> <st data-num="05915" class="">Achsah</st> as a <st data-num="0802" class="">wife</st>.”
When Othniel son of Kenaz, Caleb’s brother, captured it, Caleb gave Achsah his daughter to him as a wife.
One time Achsah came and charmed her father so that she could ask him for some land. When she got down from her donkey, Caleb said to her, “What would you like?”
She answered, “Please give me a special present. Since you have given me land in the Negev, now give me springs of water.” So he gave her both the upper and lower springs.
This is the land assigned to the tribe of Judah by its clans:

These <st data-num="05892" class="">cities</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">were located</st> at the <st data-num="05045" class="">southern</st> <st data-num="07097" class="">extremity</st> of <st data-num="01121 03063">Judah’s</st> <st data-num="04294" class="">tribal land</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">near</st> the <st data-num="01366" class="">border</st> of <st data-num="0123" class="">Edom</st>:<n id="1" /> <st data-num="06909" class="">Kabzeel</st>, <st data-num="05740" class="">Eder</st>, <st data-num="03017" class="">Jagur</st>,
<st data-num="07016" class="">Kinah</st>, <st data-num="01776" class="">Dimonah</st>, <st data-num="05735" class="">Adadah</st>,
<st data-num="06943" class="">Kedesh</st>, <st data-num="02674" class="">Hazor</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="03497" class="">Ithnan</st>,
<st data-num="02128" class="">Ziph</st>, <st data-num="02928" class="">Telem</st>, <st data-num="01175" class="">Bealoth</st>,

<st data-num="02675" class="">Hazor Hadattah</st>, <st data-num="07152" class="">Kerioth</st> <st data-num="02696" class="">Hezron</st> (<st data-num="01931" class="">that</st> is, <st data-num="02674" class="">Hazor</st>),
<st data-num="0538" class="">Amam</st>, <st data-num="08090" class="">Shema</st>, <st data-num="04137" class="">Moladah</st>,
<st data-num="02693" class="">Hazar Gaddah</st>, <st data-num="02829" class="">Heshbon</st>, <st data-num="01046" class="">Beth Pelet</st>,
<st data-num="02705" class="">Hazar Shual</st>, <st data-num="0884" class="">Beer Sheba</st>, <st data-num="0964" class="">Biziothiah</st>,
<st data-num="01173" class="">Baalah</st>, <st data-num="05864" class="">Iim</st>, <st data-num="06107" class="">Ezem</st>,
<st data-num="0513" class="">Eltolad</st>, <st data-num="03686" class="">Kesil</st>, <st data-num="02767" class="">Hormah</st>,
<st data-num="06860" class="">Ziklag</st>, <st data-num="04089" class="">Madmannah</st>, <st data-num="05578" class="">Sansannah</st>,
Lebaoth, Shilhim, Ain, and Rimmon—a total of 29 cities and their towns.
These cities were in the foothills: Eshtaol, Zorah, Ashnah,
<st data-num="02182" class="">Zanoah</st>, <st data-num="05873" class="">En Gannim</st>, <st data-num="08599" class="">Tappuah</st>, <st data-num="05879" class="">Enam</st>,
<st data-num="03412" class="">Jarmuth</st>, <st data-num="05725" class="">Adullam</st>, <st data-num="07755" class="">Socoh</st>, <st data-num="05825" class="">Azekah</st>,
Shaaraim, Adithaim, and Gederah (or Gederothaim)—a total of 14 cities and their towns.
Zenan, Hadashah, Migdal Gad,
<st data-num="01810" class="">Dilean</st>, <st data-num="04708" class="">Mizpah</st>, <st data-num="03371" class="">Joktheel</st>,
<st data-num="03923" class="">Lachish</st>, <st data-num="01218" class="">Bozkath</st>, <st data-num="05700" class="">Eglon</st>,
<st data-num="03522" class="">Cabbon</st>, <st data-num="03903" class="">Lahmas</st>, <st data-num="03798" class="">Kitlish</st>,
Gederoth, Beth Dagon, Naamah, and Makkedah—a total of 16 cities and their towns.
Libnah, Ether, Ashan,
<st data-num="03316" class="">Iphtah</st>, <st data-num="0823" class="">Ashnah</st>, <st data-num="05334" class="">Nezib</st>,
Keilah, Achzib, and Mareshah—a total of nine cities and their towns.
Ekron and its surrounding towns and settlements;

from <st data-num="06138" class="">Ekron</st> <st data-num="03220" class="">westward</st>, <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">those</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">in</st> the <st data-num="03027" class="">vicinity</st> of <st data-num="0795" class="">Ashdod</st> and their <st data-num="02691" class="">towns</st>;
Ashdod with its surrounding towns and settlements, and Gaza with its surrounding towns and settlements, as far as the Stream of Egypt and the border at the Mediterranean Sea.
These cities were in the hill country: Shamir, Jattir, Socoh,
<st data-num="01837" class="">Dannah</st>, <st data-num="07158" class="">Kiriath Sannah</st> (<st data-num="01931" class="">that</st> is, <st data-num="01688" class="">Debir)</st>,
<st data-num="06024" class="">Anab</st>, <st data-num="0851" class="">Eshtemoh</st>, <st data-num="06044" class="">Anim</st>,
Goshen, Holon, and Giloh—a total of eleven cities and their towns.
Arab, Dumah, Eshan,
<st data-num="03241" class="">Janim</st>, <st data-num="01054" class="">Beth Tappuah</st>, <st data-num="0664" class="">Aphekah</st>,
Humtah, Kiriath Arba (that is, Hebron), and Zior—a total of nine cities and their towns.
Maon, Carmel, Ziph, Juttah,
<st data-num="03157" class="">Jezreel</st>, <st data-num="03347" class="">Jokdeam</st>, <st data-num="02182" class="">Zanoah</st>,
Kain, Gibeah, and Timnah—a total of 10 cities and their towns.
Halhul, Beth Zur, Gedor,
Maarath, Beth Anoth, and Eltekon—a total of six cities and their towns.
Kiriath Baal (that is, Kiriath Jearim) and Rabbah—a total of two cities and their towns.
These cities were in the wilderness: Beth Arabah, Middin, Secacah,
Nibshan, the City of Salt, and En Gedi—a total of six cities and their towns.
The men of Judah were unable to conquer the Jebusites living in Jerusalem. The Jebusites live with the people of Judah in Jerusalem to this very day.
